member.name: T:Logos.Utility.Ascii85
member.summary: Converts between binary data and an Ascii85-encoded string.
member.remarks: See Ascii85 at Wikipedia.

member.name: M:Logos.Utility.Ascii85.Encode(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encodes the specified byte array in Ascii85.
member.returns: An Ascii85-encoded string representing the input byte array.

member.name: M:Logos.Utility.Ascii85.Decode(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes the specified Ascii85 string into the corresponding byte array.
member.returns: The decoded byte array.

member.name: T:Logos.Utility.Ascii85HttpHeader
member.summary: Converts between an Ascii85-encoded string and an escaped version that is always valid in an HTTP header. This class assumes that the "z" exception for 5 consecutive zero bytes is implemented, but the "y" exception for 5 consecutive space characters is not implemented, as is the case with the Ascii85 class.
member.remarks: See Ascii85 at Wikipedia and RFC 2616 section 2.2.

member.name: M:Logos.Utility.Ascii85HttpHeader.Encode(System.String)
member.summary:
Encodes the specified Ascii85 string for safe passage in an HTTP header by substituting other characters for characters used by Ascii85 in the set to avoid the set of separator characters not allowed in HTTP headers, which is {()<>@,;:\"/[]?=}. The curly braces aren't used by Ascii85, but cannot be used in HTTP headers, either. Since there are 15 disallowed characters, and only 6 printable ASCII characters that are both allowed in HTTP headers and not used by Ascii85, one of those (~) is used as an escape character to introduce a two-character set to represent each of 10 of those disallowed sequences.
This function would normally be used to encode the results of Ascii85.Encode().
member.returns: A string that is valid as an HTTP header.

member.name: M:Logos.Utility.Ascii85HttpHeader.Decode(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes the specified HTTP parameter string to an Ascii85 string. The results of this function would normally be fed to Ascii85.Decode().
member.returns: The Ascii85 string.

member.name: M:Logos.Utility.DelegateUtility.Cast``1(System.Delegate)
member.summary: Casts the specified delegate to the specified type.
member.returns: A delegate of the specified type which, when invoked, executes the specified delegate.
member.remarks: This method uses the CreateDelegate method of to create a new delegate from an existing delegate. Use this method to cast a delegate from one type to another, where the delegate types have exactly the same parameter types and return type.

member.returns: A delegate of the specified type which, when invoked, executes the specified delegate.
member.remarks: This method uses the CreateDelegate method of to create a new delegate from an existing delegate. Use this method to cast a delegate from one type to another, where the delegate types have exactly the same parameter types and return type.

member.summary: Verifies that the instance is not disposed.

member.name: M:Logos.Utility.DisposableService.OnDisposing
member.summary: Called during the call to Dispose, immediately before Dispose(bool) is called.
member.remarks: The object is not yet marked as disposed, so VerifyNotDisposed will not throw an exception.

member.summary: Raised by the Dispose method immediately before disposing.

member.name: T:Logos.Utility.HashCodeUtility
member.summary: Provides methods for manipulating and creating hash codes.

remarks.para: This code is based on Bob Jenkins' public domain lookup3.c code.

This work is hereby released into the Public Domain. To view a copy of the public domain dedication, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/publicdomain/ or send a letter to Creative Commons, 171 Second Street, Suite 300, San Francisco, California, 94105, USA.

member.summary: Combines the specified hash codes.
member.returns: The combined hash code.
member.remarks: This is a specialization of for efficiency.

member.name: M:Logos.Utility.HashCodeUtility.CombineHashCodes(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Combines the specified hash codes.
member.returns: The combined hash code.
member.remarks: This is a specialization of for efficiency.

member.summary: Combines the specified hash codes.
member.returns: The combined hash code.
member.remarks: This is a specialization of for efficiency.

member.summary: Combines the specified hash codes.
member.returns: The combined hash code.
member.remarks: This is a specialization of for efficiency.

member.name: M:Logos.Utility.HashCodeUtility.CombineHashCodes(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Combines the specified hash codes.
member.returns: The combined hash code.
member.remarks: This method is based on the "hashword" function at http://burtleburtle.net/bob/c/lookup3.c. It attempts to thoroughly mix all the bits in the input hash codes.

member.name: M:Logos.Utility.HashCodeUtility.GetPersistentHashCode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a hash code for the specified ; this hash code is guaranteed not to change in the future.
member.returns: A hash code for the specified .

member.name: M:Logos.Utility.HashCodeUtility.GetPersistentHashCode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a hash code for the specified ; this hash code is guaranteed not to change in the future.
member.returns: A hash code for the specified .
member.remarks: Based on Robert Jenkins' 32 bit integer hash function.

member.name: M:Logos.Utility.HashCodeUtility.GetPersistentHashCode(System.Int64)
member.summary: Gets a hash code for the specified ; this hash code is guaranteed not to change in the future.
member.returns: A hash code for the specified .
member.remarks: Based on 64 bit to 32 bit Hash Functions.

member.name: M:Logos.Utility.HashCodeUtility.GetPersistentHashCode(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a hash code for the specified ; this hash code is guaranteed not to change in the future.
member.returns: A hash code for the specified .
member.remarks: Based on SuperFastHash.

member.name: T:Logos.Utility.IO.WrappingStream
member.summary: A that wraps another stream. One major feature of is that it does not dispose the underlying stream when it is disposed if Ownership.None is used; this is useful when using classes such as and that take ownership of the stream passed to their constructors.
member.remarks: See WrappingStream Implementation.

member.summary: Begins an asynchronous write operation.

member.summary: Ends an asynchronous write operation.

member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.

member.name: M:Logos.Utility.IO.WrappingStream.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a byte from the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the stream.

member.summary: Sets the position within the current stream.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the parameter.
A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.

member.summary: Sets the length of the current stream.

member.name: M:Logos.Utility.IO.WrappingStream.WriteByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes a byte to the current position in the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte.

member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.summary: Initializes logging.
member.param: Called to create a logger implementation. Null to disable logging.
member.remarks: This method should be called exactly once. It can be called even after GetLogger has been called to create loggers; those loggers will be properly configured as well.

member.summary: Gets a logger for the specified name.
member.returns: The logger.
member.remarks: This method returns the same object for the same name.
